description: From Middle English wrongous, for earlier wrongwis, wrangwis, from Old English wrongwīs, wrangwīs (“wrongous, rough, uneven”), equivalent to wrong +‎ -ous (see also wrongwise). Cognate with Swedish vrångvis (“wrong, iniquitous”). See wrong, and compare righteous.

adjectives.description: wrongous (comparative more wrongous, superlative most wrongous)

entries.meaning: (UK dialectal, Scotland, especially law) Wrongful; not right; unjust; illegal.
